alert.note: Alert for Olmsted; Wabasha (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 23 at 4:58PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact eastern Olmsted and Wabasha Counties through 530 PM CDT... At 457 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Goodhue to 6 miles northeast of Oronoco to 6 miles east of Rochester. Movement was north at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Elgin around 505 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include South Troy, Rattelsnake Point, Potsdam, Hidden Meadows R V Park, West Albany, County Roads 33 And 4, Kings Park, Bremen, Theilman, and Maple Springs. People attending the Gar-Lin Dairy Farm should seek safe shelter immediately! This includes Interstate 90 in Minnesota between mile markers 222 and 225. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
